title: KRKX
text:
KRKX (94.1 <a href="FM%20Broadcasting">FM</a>) is a commercial <a href="radio%20station">radio station</a> in <a href="Billings%2C%20Montana">Billings, Montana</a>. KRKX airs a <a href="country%20music">country music</a> format.
Ownership.
In June 2006, KRKX was acquired by Cherry Creek Radio from Fisher Radio Regional Group as part of a 24 station deal with a total reported sale price of $33.3 million. Recently KRKX switched its local morning show to a nationally satellite delivered show titled " Tony and Kris in the morning" replacing D.J. Captain Mike's morning show.
On January 1, 2010, KRKX changed their format to country, branded as "K-Sky".
On May 7, 2019, <a href="Connoisseur%20Media">Connoisseur Media</a> announced that it would sell its Billings cluster to Desert Mountain Broadcasting, an entity formed by Connoisseur Billings general manager Cam Maxwell. The sale closed on July 31, 2019.
